review.title: The concept "altruism" for sociological research: from conceptualization to operationalization
review.abstract: This article addresses the question of the relevant conceptualization of {\guillemotleft}altruism{\guillemotright} in Russian from the perspective sociological research operationalization. It investigates the spheres of social application of the word {\guillemotleft}altruism{\guillemotright}, include Russian equivalent {\guillemotleft}vzaimopomoshh`{\guillemotright} (mutual help). The data for the study comes from Russian National Corpus (Russian). The theoretical framework consists of Paul F. Lazarsfeld`s Theory of Sociological Research Methodology and the Natural Semantic Metalanguage (NSM). Quantitative analysis shows features in the representation of altruism in Russian that sociologists need to know in the preparation of questionnaires, interview guides and analysis of transcripts.

metadata.title: The concept «altruism» for sociological research: from conceptualization to operationalization

sections.text: This article deals with the question of the relevant conceptualization of "altruism" in Russian from the perspective of sociological research operationalization. It examines the spheres of social application of the word "altruism," including the Russian equivalent "vzaimopomoshh" (mutual aid).The data for the study comes from the Russian National Corpus (Russian).The theoretical framework consists of Paul F. Lazarsfeld's theory of sociological research methodology and the Natural Semantic Metalanguage (NSM).Quantitative analyses show characteristics in the representation of altruism in Russian that sociologists need to know when preparing questionnaires, interview guides and analyses of transcripts. Keywords: altruism, social categories, natural semanguón metalóguage (NSM), sociological operationalization, corpus linguisticsResumes: Este artículo se abordíón la sociación socialación (NSM).

sections.heading: 1. Introduction
sections.text: This article presents a study on the conceptualization of "altruism" from thesociological operationalization perspective and includes small scale study which analyzes how the concept of altruism and its Russian equivalent "vzaimopomoshh '" (mutual assistance) is used in Russian language. Operationalization is part of the empirical research process (Shields, Rangarjan 2013).To translate the concept on "the language of the questionnaire," thedevelopment of in-depth semi-structured interview guide and to work with the transcript should be operationalization - empirical interpretation of the concept, i.e. the procedure for describing concepts through the indicators, having the properties: a) the validity, c) repeatability, Pavassov 2013 we are sociassov 2013.

sections.heading: 3. Data and Methodology
sections.text: In fact, the Russian language has two concepts that encompass the narrowest social phenomena - "altruism" and "vzaimopomoshh" - which turn out to be synonyms and which are a characteristic of their most frequent uses in main, regional and social policy. "It is a system of reference based on a particular language," he says. "It is very important that the language is able to capture the different genres, styles and social characteristics."

Chi-square tests show the importance of the differences between the use of the word" altruism "and" vzaimopomoshh "mutual help. (p < 0.001) In addition, we confirmed the high importance of the differences in the use of the two words in a more rigorous testament Cramer's V. (p < 0.001).
